channel.title: ASF JIRA
channel.description: This file is an XML representation of an issue

item.title: [HBASE-10916] [VisibilityController] Stackable ScanLabelGenerators
item.description: The ScanLabelGenerator is used by the VisibilityController to assemble the effective label set for a user in the RPC context before processing any request. Currently only one implementation of this interface can be installed, although which implementation to use can be specified in the site file. Instead it should be possible to stack multiple implementations of this component the same way we do coprocessors, installed with explicit priority with ties broken by a counter, where those implementations installed later in the chain have an opportunity to modify the pending effective label set.

status.description: The issue is considered finished, the resolution is correct. Issues which are closed can be reopened.

comments.comment: I can take up this Andy (if ok with u)

Go for it Anoop, I assigned the parent issue to you!

After it's committed, we could split up work on the subtasks.
A minor related issue is the question of whether we should be calling these "ScanLabelGenerators" or "ScanAuthsGenerators".

whether we should be calling these "ScanLabelGenerators" or "ScanAuthsGenerators"

+1 for ScanAuthsGenerators. That would be a better name.
The conf we have named as "hbase.regionserver.scan.visibility.label.generator.class" already.
We should change the configuration key name too while we can. We can keep the old one around in 0.98 as an alias.
Whether we need to consider Table level ScanLabelGenerator also?

The SLG is a public interface exposed.


@InterfaceAudience.Public

@InterfaceStability.Evolving

public interface ScanLabelGenerator extends Configurable

What is ur call on changing the name now Andy?
Also we might better change the signature of the method in it considering we will have a chain of SLGs now


public List<String> getLabels(User user, Authorizations authorizations);

be better changed to


public List<String> getAuths(User user, List<String> auths);

What is ur call on changing the name now Andy?

Change it while we can, while we have no users of it yet. But it's just an interface, so let's make the ScanAuthsGenerator, keep ScanLabelGenerator and have it inherit from ScanAuthsGenerator, but deprecate it, and keep any existing SLG methods we don't put into SAG in SLG, also deprecated.

+1.
Bq.while we have no users
Same reason, I was thinking we can change directly. Will go with deprecate way only.wl give patch tomorrow

In trunk we can directly change and for 98 branch we can go with new interface way

so let's make the ScanAuthsGenerator, keep ScanLabelGenerator and have it inherit from ScanAuthsGenerator

Or it should be the reverse way? In order to be src and binary compatible we have to do the reverse way around. In VC we have to refer the impl as SLG only and call the deprecated method (for 98) to be compatible. Correct me if I am wrong
Yep you get the idea.
Critical for 0.98.2 because of HBASE-10918

-1 overall. Here are the results of testing the latest attachment
http://issues.apache.org/jira/secure/attachment/12641196/HBASE-10916.patch
against trunk revision .
ATTACHMENT ID: 12641196

+1 @author. The patch does not contain any @author tags.

+1 tests included. The patch appears to include 2 new or modified tests.

+1 javadoc. The javadoc tool did not generate any warning messages.

-1 javac. The patch appears to cause mvn compile goal to fail.

-1 findbugs. The patch appears to cause Findbugs (version 1.3.9) to fail.

+1 release audit. The applied patch does not increase the total number of release audit warnings.

+1 lineLengths. The patch does not introduce lines longer than 100

-1 site. The patch appears to cause mvn site goal to fail.

-1 core tests. The patch failed these unit tests:

Let me try testing this patch locally to see what's going on with precommit on this issue (if anything germane). Looks like a timeout.

I got the following when using command line to build:


[ERROR] Failed to execute goal org.apache.maven.plugins:maven-compiler-plugin:2.5.1:compile (default-compile) on project hbase-server: Compilation failure: Compilation failure:

[ERROR] /Users/tyu/trunk/hbase-server/src/main/java/org/apache/hadoop/hbase/security/visibility/TestVisibilityLabelsWithSLGStack.java:[28,30] cannot find symbol

[ERROR] symbol  : class HBaseTestingUtility

[ERROR] location: package org.apache.hadoop.hbase

[ERROR] /Users/tyu/trunk/hbase-server/src/main/java/org/apache/hadoop/hbase/security/visibility/TestVisibilityLabelsWithSLGStack.java:[30,30] cannot find symbol

[ERROR] symbol  : class MediumTests

[ERROR] location: package org.apache.hadoop.hbase

[ERROR] /Users/tyu/trunk/hbase-server/src/main/java/org/apache/hadoop/hbase/security/visibility/TestVisibilityLabelsWithSLGStack.java:[52,22] cannot find symbol

[ERROR] symbol  : class HBaseTestingUtility

[ERROR] location: class org.apache.hadoop.hbase.security.visibility.TestVisibilityLabelsWithSLGStack

[ERROR] /Users/tyu/trunk/hbase-server/src/main/java/org/apache/hadoop/hbase/security/visibility/TestVisibilityLabelsWithSLGStack.java:[47,10] cannot find symbol

[ERROR] symbol: class MediumTests

[ERROR] @Category(MediumTests.class)

[ERROR] /Users/tyu/trunk/hbase-server/src/main/java/org/apache/hadoop/hbase/security/visibility/TestVisibilityLabelsWithSLGStack.java:[52,58] cannot find symbol

[ERROR] symbol  : class HBaseTestingUtility

[ERROR] location: class org.apache.hadoop.hbase.security.visibility.TestVisibilityLabelsWithSLGStack

The test passes in Eclipse though.

I put up a comment that the patch passed on the precommit build, but have just removed it because in fact, no it did not. Further down the log is the same compilation issue Ted found. Let's refresh the patch.

What is odd is that precommit ran tests afterward. Precommit builds don't clean the workspace!
I logged HBASE-11051 to improve test script - so that we don't need to paste maven output manually.
Cause of the compilation error was due to TestVisibilityLabelsWithSLGStack.java being added under hbase-server/src/main - it should have been added under hbase-server/src/test

Cause of the compilation error was due to TestVisibilityLabelsWithSLGStack.java being added under hbase-server/src/main

Ah!! thats my bad!! Problem caused with a copy paste from one Eclipse env to another.. Thanks for that good eye Ted.

customfieldvalues.customfieldvalue: One can configure a set of ScanLabelGenerators to be used by the system. For this, a comma separated set of implementation class names to be configured for config "hbase.regionserver.scan.visibility.label.generator.class".
